page.title: 07Housing:Nether & Over Silton
page.content: The majority of houses in Over Silton are owner occupied;most are very attractive new or modernised and improved stone built properties.There is an increasing trend for old houses in this area to be bought and improved by those working in the large towns. Nether Silton however has a greater proportion of rented houses as a large part of the village is privately owned by Silton Hall Estate. Silton Hall situated at the Western end of the village green was formerly a school for orphans of the clergy established in 1800.The cottages owned by the estate are stone built,detached or semi detached and some date from the 16th century although there was a period of building early in the 19th century.Apart from the two council houses there is only one new home in Nether Silton built in 1974.
